Today is Free Fresh Produce Thursday! The USDA Farmers to Families Food Box programs initiative provides fresh produce to families. This distribution occurs weekly on Thursdays from 9 a.m. to 12 p.m. at Hazel Park High School (23400 Hughes Ave, Hazel Park , MI 48030) and runs through August!

It is first-come, first-serve and everyone is welcome to pick up the food. We will have 1,400 boxes of food for pick up. Large families can pick up multiple boxes and you are welcome to pick up boxes for seniors, people without cars, folks who are disabled or ill in any community, i.e., anyone really, just please don’t waste it.

Pick Up Procedures:
Please drive to the back of the school and enter at the second entrance on Felker Ave.
Please pull around to the sidewalk up to the first person available and open your trunk to be placed into your vehicle. Please do not get out of your vehicle.
Once you receive the box of produce you will exit out of the parking lot and turn right on Felker toward the tennis courts.

Dear Hazel Park Schools Parents/Guardians,

Our last survey indicated that over 50% of our parents/guardians wanted in-person education starting in the fall. In order to give choice, we also have a 100% K-12 virtual option taught by Hazel Park teachers.

Before the Board of Education makes their final decision, we would like to assess your current preference for your family. Please click on the following link to complete the survey: HPS Parent Return to School Survey 2 (https://forms.gle/hHUF51YH6RHB6bSu8)

We would appreciate your response as soon as possible so we may understand your family's needs. We will be in person at Ford Administrative Center on July 28 from 5pm-8pm if you would like more information. Please wear a mask.

The Great Start Collaborative has created the Bee Bingo to support families in finding fun and development-appropriate activities for this summer.

We find that pictures or videos of real families are very powerful! That's is why it would be great if you could support this online event by picking one (or more!) of these activities to do with your child and send us a picture or a short video (just a few seconds long) of you guys doing it, so we can share it on our social media to encourage more families to participate.

Let me know if you would like to be part of this, and which activity you would like to send in, so we can have as many as possible. Don't forget that whenever you complete a line or the whole bingo, you can win prizes! (Click on the link to see them) Feel free to share with your friends and family as well!

Also, if you want to have the bingo card on paper and you can't print at home, you can request a hard copy sending an email and your mailing address to millie.wright@oakland.k12.mi.us

Today is Free Fresh Produce Thursday! The USDA Farmers to Families Food Box programs initiative provides fresh produce to families. This distribution occurs weekly on Thursdays from 9 a.m. to 12 p.m. at Hazel Park High School (23400 Hughes Ave, Hazel Park , MI 48030) and runs through August!

It is first-come, first-serve and everyone is welcome to pick up the food. We will have 1,400 boxes of food for pick up. Large families can pick up multiple boxes and you are welcome to pick up boxes for seniors, people without cars, folks who are disabled or ill in any community, i.e., anyone really, just please don’t waste it.

Pick Up Procedures:
Please drive to the back of the school and enter at the second entrance on Felker Ave.
Please pull around to the sidewalk up to the first person available and open your trunk to be placed into your vehicle. Please do not get out of your vehicle.
Once you receive the box of produce you will exit out of the parking lot and turn right on Felker toward the tennis courts.

Today is Free Fresh Produce Thursday! The USDA Farmers to Families Food Box programs initiative provides fresh produce to families. This distribution occurs weekly on Thursdays from 9 a.m. to 12 p.m. at Hazel Park High School (23400 Hughes Ave, Hazel Park , MI 48030) and runs through August!

It is first-come, first-serve and everyone is welcome to pick up the food. We will have 1,400 boxes of food for pick up. Large families can pick up multiple boxes and you are welcome to pick up boxes for seniors, people without cars, folks who are disabled or ill in any community, i.e., anyone really, just please don’t waste it.

Pick Up Procedures:
Please drive to the back of the school and enter at the second entrance on Felker Ave.
Please pull around to the sidewalk up to the first person available and open your trunk to be placed into your vehicle. Please do not get out of your vehicle.
Once you receive the box of produce you will exit out of the parking lot and turn right on Felker toward the tennis courts.

Today is Free Fresh Produce Thursday! The USDA Farmers to Families Food Box programs initiative provides fresh produce to families. This distribution occurs weekly on Thursdays from 9 a.m. to 12 p.m. at Hazel Park High School (23400 Hughes Ave, Hazel Park , MI 48030) and runs through August!

It is first-come, first-serve and everyone is welcome to pick up the food. We will have 1,400 boxes of food for pick up. Large families can pick up multiple boxes and you are welcome to pick up boxes for seniors, people without cars, folks who are disabled or ill in any community, i.e., anyone really, just please don’t waste it.

Pick Up Procedures:
Please drive to the back of the school and enter at the second entrance on Felker Ave.
Please pull around to the sidewalk up to the first person available and open your trunk to be placed into your vehicle. Please do not get out of your vehicle.
Once you receive the box of produce you will exit out of the parking lot and turn right on Felker toward the tennis courts.

Live Shark Cam - Monterey Bay Aquarium
Spot sharks, rays and other fishes as they cruise through our rocky reef.
Sevengill sharks, leopard sharks, spiny dogfish and the elusive Pacific angel shark all dwell in our Monterey Bay Habitats exhibit—like they do just beyond our walls in the cold waters of the bay. Designed with sharks in mind, this exhibit's 90-foot-long hourglass shape gives our big sharks plenty of room to glide and turn.
Watch carefully and you might see big skates and bat rays pass by the window, just like their shark kin. Plus, keep your eyes peeled for sturgeon coasting through the water, rockfish and giant sea bass relaxing by the reef, and flatfish nestling on the sandy seafloor.

Today is Free Fresh Produce Thursday! The USDA Farmers to Families Food Box programs initiative provides fresh produce to families. This distribution occurs weekly on Thursdays from 9 a.m. to 12 p.m. at Hazel Park High School (23400 Hughes Ave, Hazel Park , MI 48030) and runs through August!

It is first-come, first-serve and everyone is welcome to pick up the food. We will have 1,400 boxes of food for pick up. Large families can pick up multiple boxes and you are welcome to pick up boxes for seniors, people without cars, folks who are disabled or ill in any community, i.e., anyone really, just please don’t waste it.

Pick Up Procedures:
Please drive to the back of the school and enter at the second entrance on Felker Ave.
Please pull around to the sidewalk up to the first person available and open your trunk to be placed into your vehicle. Please do not get out of your vehicle.
Once you receive the box of produce you will exit out of the parking lot and turn right on Felker toward the tennis courts.
